After playing BO7 through gamepass... Perhaps you were treated too harshly. 

lol

After the tragedy that was BO6, I bet we can all lower our standards a bit and appreciate this game for what it is. I'm glad there are still a lot of active players. I know this game is hated by many, but I actually like it a lot.

The campgain isnt as bad as people say, Its like a 7/10, The campgain story was understandable, Some missions were lacking some cinematic gameplay, I have played myself CoD MW2 (2009) and MW 1, MW2 (2021) And this campgain is the worst one, but not that bad.

I was a fan of Modern Warfare 2019, and this game seems to be a direct upgrade and enjoyable in many more ways. I think shipment 24/7 being in the rotation constantly is straight cancer but very fun at the same time. 

The graphics still blow my mind and to be honest I think this Call of Duty is the best in terms of looks and realism, if we are not counting the lasers DLCs and the fact that you can see a banana man along with Nicki Minaj and Rambo running around shipment with riot shields and an auto shotty. The amount of detail in the reloading animations alone shows that they were not playing around.  To be honest, 2019 graphics were already admirable, but these ones.. this is next level. The game, surprisingly, runs smooth. Sucks that every CoD after 2019 being shit brings down the perception of this one.

Also, the vast amount of attachments for each gun is amazing -- can try multiple builds for a single weapon.

The unlock system is straight buns. Why do i need to do challenges with weapon B to unlock a single attachment for weapon A that I will try once and probably hate? why TF do I need to do daily challenges to unlock the ability to equip a killstreak. I am almost level 200 in Multiplayer and I still have many killstreaks locked. 

As for camos, getting mastery camos does not seem too tedious compared to DAMASCUS from 2019 (kill me) so I guess thats a good thing.
Love every second of playing this call of duty and it's one of the best modern cods we have gotten in years, even black ops 6 and 7 is not as fun as this one. Thank you for making this game

Definitely one of the better CoD games to come out in recent years. Is it overdone? Yeah. Is it overpriced? Yeah. But the game plays well, has all of the MW2 maps, and is extremely well optimized (except for the size). Even a Steam Deck can run this at medium settings, so there's that. This game is mediocre.

Kind of hard to recommend as the MP and Zombies remain active but not active as one might hope especially for a cod title that is as recent as this one.

MWZ was the biggest surprise for me personally, it's the only offshoot of traditional round based zombies that I've ever found to be actually fun and engaging. I genuinely really enjoy being able to control the difficulty and pacing, game to game. Being able to chill in Tier 1 areas and farm exfils, or if you have good luck at the start being able to push into Tier 2 or 3 areas very early on.

There are tons of camos and weapons to grind, and overall the gameplay is incredibly solid. I find the multiplayer to be really satisfying, especially hardcore. I was a big fan of MW 2019 (other than it's incredibly drab and gray color palette in some maps) when it released, and this game feels like a really good hybridization of MW 2019 and MW2 2022.

(Supposedly) generative A.I. was used in this game but only for the generation of concept art for cosmetics. That aside this might be the last cod game fully made my human beings. Speaking of which this game has the most horrid paid cosmetics I've ever seen in a video game. Genuinely horrific dogshit.

Black Ops 6 and on, I would consider the true death of the franchise unless Activision decides to revert from using generative A.I. and hopefully consider allowing future call of duty titles more than a single year of development. I think that's the only thing they can do at this point to try and get people interested in Call of Duty as a franchise again.

My take is that if you buy it with a 50% discount, it's worth buying and playing. I'm looking forward to grinding it over Christmas break instead of buying and playing Black Ops 7, I would encourage you to do the same if your looking for a newer call of duty game to sink your teeth into and you didn't get around to playing this. 

However if you did play Modern Warfare 2's multiplayer already and invested a lot of time into it, then it's more of the same here so you are probably better off skipping it.

The campaign is fast-paced, explosive, and packed with variety. It delivers some great set pieces and keeps the action moving, blending classic cinematic missions with more open-ended ones where you can approach objectives your way. The characters are still a highlight, and it ties together the reboot‚Äôs storyline in a satisfying way. It‚Äôs a shorter ride, but a fun and polished one, definitely worth playing if you enjoy the modern MW campaigns.

This isn't a terrible COD. Now is it the best? No not even close, but it's not terrible. Just like with the other CODs do not let the mixed reviews deter you from trying these games. This is a competitive game so people will give bad reviews just because they suck at the game. 

Now for me this COD isn't terrible. The movement system feels really nice and the guns have lots of customization options, I almost never play on the same map twice and there are tons of maps giving a nice variety (although I quit some matches depending on the map cause some maps are just designed for campers and those games are boring as crap), and people choose these stupid really bright skins that makes them easy to spot and easy to hit so I tend to get more kills because of that. 

Now there are a lot of negatives but honestly it just depends on you on whether you think it's bad or not. The gun progression system is annoying and a big pain in the butt for me (I don't like having to use 3 different assualt rifles just to unlock one smg that I want to use), earlier I talked about the campy maps that are really annoying and boring, the skins ruin the immersion sometimes and other times they are just funny, if you play at night get ready to fight the no-lifer discord moderators who play this game more than they call 13 year old girls kitten, unlocking modifications for guns are really annoying, and the campaign is kind of just meh. 

I choose to play this COD because I love the modern warfare series and in my opinion modern warfare is so much better than black ops (besides black ops 2, no cod will beat that) and I like having the nicer graphics and the nice movement systems that the old CODs just didn't have. Before this COD I really really enjoyed modern warfare 2019 and would only play it (Besides the movement system I like mw2019 more). So if those are things you value I'd say try this one.

Worth it on sale, probably the best modern Call of duty since Modern Warfare 2019 by far, and pretty chill now that all the unemployed are on the newer CODs, and in a way the definitive modern COD.

You have 40+ maps, 100+ weapons, and 100+ aftermarket parts to convert the weapons into other stuff. Unlocking the post launch content is also much easier than previous CODs, because you can just do daily challenges/win games to unlock them instead of doing whack challenges. Grinding every individual gun is also much easier, because each gun has universal attachments and about 20-30 weapon levels instead of 50+ like every other new COD.

The gameplay plays like Modern Warfare 2019 with faster handling speeds basically, but it's also possible to play fast without spamming slide cancels like BO6 and BO7, meaning you can play as chill or as sweaty as you want.

The maps contain all of MW2 2009's 16 launch maps, plus about 24 post launch maps which are the typical modern COD three lane maps, although they are pretty good.
Campaign is pretty ass, but the MP is the best we had for a few years. Its also better than Bo6 and Bo7 ngl.

The zombie mode is the only worthwhile feature; however, the campaign is very short and not worth playing. The multiplayer is decent, so if you want to play zombie mode or DMZ, then buy this game; otherwise, consider purchasing Call of MW2 instead.

I cannot recommend this game because Microsoft doesn't deserve a fucking dime, even though MWIII is technically a great release for a cod game.

Don't bother with the campaign or zombies, multiplayer is the real highlight here. Loads of weapons to unlock with multiple unique attachments that can basically turn the weapon into something entirely different, many of which are nods to previous cod releases (Turning the MK2 Carbine from MWII into Akimbo Model 1887s for example). All of the base MW2 2009 maps and a bunch of new (and returning) maps that play very well. Movement is quick, ttk steady, and plenty of modes to mess around in (Demolition being a highlight, personally). There are several ways to counter riot shield users, varying from under barrel flamethrowers and chainsaws, and a sword that can just delete shielders even if they are facing you.

Sledgehammer deserves better for delivering such a solid and fun experience. It's irrelevant now but it could be noted that during the game's "lifespan" or active seasons, Sledge did a fantastic job supporting the game. I played from the beta all the way to the last update, completed each weekly challenge, and still didn't feel completely burned out like the camo grinds and FOMO events of the past. There have been many cod releases where I'd find an issue and it wouldn't get fixed for literal months or even not at all, whereas Sledge fixed most issues days after they came up. The only thing I dislike or don't care for is that the player skins can be ridiculous or dumb and don't really look like they're all from the same series (even disregarding crossover skins). It lacks a clear visual identity, which can be said for pretty much all modern cod releases outside of Cold War, which stuck mostly an 80s/90s adjacent aesthetic.

Once again, the entire team at Sledge deserves better.

Game is what you would expect of a 2-3 year old modern COD game at this point. If you play more than an hour or two, you usually replay the same lobbies. Kind of annoying when you get groups of players trying their best when you're looking for a goof around game. Or, when you get another lobby with someone obviously cheating multiple times per play session. That has been the experience I've had my last few plays. Besides stated, the community in this game is not great, but is what is expected of a modern COD game. It's either no one talking until they're losing and blaming others, or racial slurs off the rip for no reason and no in between.

Despite complaints, the core game/engine is pretty nice and enjoyable. Movement is pretty nice other than not being able to shoot while diving. However, I feel the cons out weigh the pros, especially considering the price.

Also worth mentioning that I played this game when it was on the HQ and I primarily played on the PS5 version, so I have a lot more playtime. I had to launch this relisted version to rewrite my review.

In case if anyone is confused, this is the 2023 MW3, not the 2011 MW3. If you are looking for a great game, the 2011 game is the game for you.

Old review from 2023:

Campaign, Multiplayer, Modern Warfare Zombies (MWZ), Warzone 2.0 (or 3.0 or whatever it was called at this point, I never paid attention to Warzone at this point) & the other game modes all either suck or are mediocre at best.

You can literally play the Campaign, beat it, then refund it on Steam before your 2 hours are up. If you took the campaign and characters from the 2011 MW3, or just the original MW trilogy in general, and made them as terrible as possible, MW3 2023 is what you get. Makarov for example, the original Makarov set off a nuke that killed 30,000 soldiers, carried out a terrorist attack at a Russian airport, killed your American character that he knew was a secret CIA spy, invaded America, started World War III, gassed and then invaded Europe all the way to Paris in 6 hours, almost always knew where you were, Kidnapped the russian president and his daughter, killed every major character except Price and more. This new Makarov? An absolute failure who gets captured and fails at committing attacks.

As for Multiplayer, this game was originally gonna be DLC for MW2 2022 and it shows. Everything is basically copy and pasted, Activision even said at first that, after MW2 2022 released, that game would be a 2 year game as apposed to the traditional 1 year, meaning we weren't supposed to get a new COD game until Black Ops 6 in 2024. We were instead gonna get some kind of DLC for 2023. They changed their mind last second and this is the result.

I cannot recommend this game because Microsoft doesn't deserve a fucking dime, even though MWIII is technically a great release for a cod game.

Don't bother with the campaign or zombies, multiplayer is the real highlight here. Loads of weapons to unlock with multiple unique attachments that can basically turn the weapon into something entirely different, many of which are nods to previous cod releases (Turning the MK2 Carbine from MWII into Akimbo Model 1887s for example). All of the base MW2 2009 maps and a bunch of new (and returning) maps that play very well. Movement is quick, ttk steady, and plenty of modes to mess around in (Demolition being a highlight, personally). There are several ways to counter riot shield users, varying from under barrel flamethrowers and chainsaws, and a sword that can just delete shielders even if they are facing you.

Sledgehammer deserves better for delivering such a solid and fun experience. It's irrelevant now but it could be noted that during the game's "lifespan" or active seasons, Sledge did a fantastic job supporting the game. I played from the beta all the way to the last update, completed each weekly challenge, and still didn't feel completely burned out like the camo grinds and FOMO events of the past. There have been many cod releases where I'd find an issue and it wouldn't get fixed for literal months or even not at all, whereas Sledge fixed most issues days after they came up. The only thing I dislike or don't care for is that the player skins can be ridiculous or dumb and don't really look like they're all from the same series (even disregarding crossover skins). It lacks a clear visual identity, which can be said for pretty much all modern cod releases outside of Cold War, which stuck mostly an 80s/90s adjacent aesthetic.

Once again, the entire team at Sledge deserves better.
